metadata.title: CVE-2022-1350 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in GhostPCL 9.55.0.This vulnerability affects the function chunk_free_object of the filegsmchunk.c. The manipulation with a malicious file leads to a memorycorruption. The attack can be initiated remotely but requires userinteraction. The exploit has been disclosed to the public as a POC and maybe used. It is recommended to apply the patches to fix this issue.

criterions.comment: ghostscript: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
